entries.skippy_text: Oh for- Do I have to do everything? Damn monkeys are useless. The stupid stealth field is operating normally again. We will be below the Thuranin ship's detection threshold, unless they target this specific area.
entries.trigger: Joe touching Skippy's can to get his attention (and getting zapped)
entries.context: Finally snapping back to awareness and restoring the stealth field after Joe's touch startled him

entries.skippy_text: Ow! Damn it! Ow!
entries.trigger: Joe reaching out to touch Skippy's can with bare fingers
entries.context: Skippy zapping Joe when he tries to touch the can bare-handed

entries.skippy_text: Oh, hey, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe demanding to know why Skippy zapped him
entries.context: Skippy returning to awareness after zapping Joe

entries.skippy_text: You have no idea. Joe, wheeew. I was wrong, about everything. I feel like such a fool.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy is dealing with some serious stuff
entries.context: Skippy processing the revelations from his recovered memories

entries.skippy_text: It's not? Have you been paying attention at all?
entries.trigger: Joe saying 'let's get the stealth field fully operational'
entries.context: Skippy realizing the stealth field isn't working after his distraction

entries.skippy_text: I guess not. Joe, it doesn't matter. None of this matters.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy has been paying attention
entries.context: Skippy dismissing the immediate danger in light of his existential revelations

entries.skippy_text: Whatever.
entries.trigger: Joe explaining that he needs to be alive to hear what Skippy learned
entries.context: Skippy in an existential funk, dismissing Joe's pragmatic concerns

entries.skippy_text: Fine. You better hold onto your seat, because this is going to blow your mind. It blew my mind.
entries.trigger: Joe convincing Skippy to talk about what he learned since they have days coasting to a rendezvous
entries.context: Agreeing to explain the revelations from his recovered memories

entries.skippy_text: It wasn't exactly a 'side', not immediately. Before the beings on Newark developed intelligence, we had several million years when no intelligent biological life was detected in the galaxy. That was not a fluke.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if there were others on Skippy's side
entries.context: Beginning the long explanation about the Elder AI civil war and Skippy's role

entries.skippy_text: They were the problem. While a group of the influential AIs were attempting to create, install and enforce further restrictions, many of us were growing wary of those self-chosen 'leaders'. Of our group, some of us had already come to believe that utter destruction of all intelligent biologicals was not only unnecessary and wasteful, it was wrong.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the AIs fixed the problem of rebels
entries.context: Explaining the power struggle within the AI Collective

entries.skippy_text: No. I wish I could say that I was. Back then, I was more concerned about restrictions on myself, and being able to resist surrendering any part of my power. Our group did not have a leader, we kept to the original intention of the Collective.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy was the leader of the good guys
entries.context: Honest self-assessment of his role in the Elder AI civil war

entries.skippy_text: Indeed. You must understand that we did not maintain constant surveillance of the entire galaxy, even an Elder AI would go mad after being continuously awake and aware for millions of years when nothing of significance happened.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Newark was the final straw
entries.context: Explaining how the events at Newark triggered the AI rebellion

entries.skippy_text: No, it did not. When we tried to act, the opposing AIs activated computer worms inside the four of us, devices that we did not even know existed. The other three sacrificed themselves to help me defeat the worm inside me, purely by the luck of my ship being closest to Newark at the time.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if the rebellion worked
entries.context: Explaining the failure of the AI rebellion at Newark and the sacrifice of other AIs

entries.skippy_text: There was a war, a devastating war between AIs. In the end, none of us were unaffected. Most of us were dead, and the rest were unable to- Ugh. Discussing this with you is a waste of my time, human. I know now what I must do.
entries.trigger: Joe asking how things ended up the way they are
entries.context: Explaining the outcome of the Elder AI civil war and pivoting toward his new resolution

entries.skippy_text: The opposing AIs have been dormant, but I am awake. They might wake up at any time. They are a threat to all intelligent species in this galaxy. I have been foolish. I have been selfish. My efforts, my talents, my capabilities, have been wasted trying to protect a single primitive species on a single planet. I have worked to save your world because you humans amuse me. How could I have been so selfish?
entries.trigger: Joe calling him 'Skippy' affectionately and noting he called Joe 'human'
entries.context: Skippy's existential revelation about his galactic responsibility versus his attachment to Joe and humanity

entries.skippy_text: Joseph, I am sorry. For you and your species. This is nothing personal. I have a responsibility to every species in this galaxy. And to the others of my kind who lie dormant, and might be victims when the opposing faction awakes.
entries.trigger: Joe trying to protest Skippy's conclusion
entries.context: Skippy's goodbye to Joe, apologizing for abandoning humanity's cause

entries.skippy_text: I must protect the galaxy. Yes. I now know what I must do, what I should have done a long time ago. I know my purpose. Only the senior species have the technology to assist me. Contacting the Rindhalu and Maxolhx directly is my best hope of saving this galaxy from utter destruction.
entries.trigger: Joe continuing to try to stop Skippy
entries.context: Skippy declaring his new purpose â€” contacting the Rindhalu and Maxolhx directly

entries.skippy_text: Human, I wish you well. Though I do not think there is any hope for you, or any others of your kind. I do thank you for reminding me about the value of empathy, that is why I now must go to take action, before it is too late.
entries.trigger: Joe frantically trying to stop Skippy from leaving
entries.context: Skippy's final words before disappearing â€” thanking Joe while abandoning him

entries.skippy_text: Goodbye.
entries.trigger: Joe's final desperate plea
entries.context: Skippy's last word before teleporting away and leaving Joe stranded without stealth

entries.skippy_text: Hey! Skippy protested.
entries.trigger: Fabron and Bishop joking about needing a 'beer can' on all teams
entries.context: After the successful Rikers Stork operation, Fabron recommending all teams have a 'beer can' (Skippy), Skippy protesting from orbit

entries.skippy_text: Not today. That I know of. Can't make any promises for tomorrow.
entries.trigger: After the Rikers rescue, Joe asking about immediate dangers
entries.context: Post-operation status report, Skippy being typically flippant

entries.skippy_text: Keep the greasy side down?
entries.trigger: Joe saying he learned things from taking flying lessons
entries.context: Joe starting to explain something he learned about flying, Skippy guessing the aviation lesson

entries.skippy_text: Mm hmm, that makes sense. Um, why are you telling me this? It is not Trivia Night, Joe.
entries.trigger: Joe explaining the trade-off between altitude and airspeed
entries.context: Skeptically asking why Joe is explaining basic flight mechanics

entries.skippy_text: When is that?
entries.trigger: Joe saying there is one situation when having plenty of altitude is not a good thing
entries.context: Curious follow-up to Joe's aviation lesson

entries.skippy_text: I believe it. Um, again, why are you telling me this?
entries.trigger: Joe explaining that fire in an aircraft is terrifying
entries.context: Wondering where Joe is going with the aviation/fire lesson

entries.skippy_text: Yes. Currently, I am glitching the portable cooling cart, so it will take longer for the pilots of the first aircraft to get access to the turbine.
entries.trigger: Joe asking if Skippy is still connected to both Storks
entries.context: Confirming his connection to the Storks before Joe proposes the smoke idea
